transcript.text: My fellow countrymen and women
We are living through a horrific time.
We are experiencing a national tragedy.
Last night the French capital suffered attacks of unprecedented savagery
that demonstrate a further escalation in Islamist terrorist violence.
It is the sixth time this has struck our country in 2015.
France is mourning its dead, and I cry with her.
I also think of the many injured, some in critical condition.
I want to share my deepest sympathy and my solidarity with the grieving families who have been scarred by this.
I welcome the dedication and professionalism of our police and emergency services
and I want to express my sincere thanks to them. The whole nation should admire them.
France and the French are no longer safe.
It is my duty is to tell you this
and emergency measures are required.
France really has to decide who her allies and who her enemies are.
Her enemies are those countries that have good relationships with radical Islamism.
It is also those countries that have an ambiguous attitude to terrorist organisations.
All those who are fighting these are France's allies and must be treated as such.
The President of the Republic announced the State of Emergency and temporary control of the borders.
That is fine. But what does the European Union say about it, it is essential that France regains definitive control of its borders.
Without borders there is no possible protection nor security.
France has been made vulnerable.
It must rearm because for too long it has been suffering from a scheduled collapse in its ability to protect and defend while faced with predictable and growing threats.
It must re-establish its military, police, gendarmerie, intelligence services and border control.
The State must be able to carry out its core task of protecting the French people.
And finally, Islamic fundamentalism must be wiped out.
France must ban Islamic organisations, close radical mosques
and expel foreigners who preach hatred on our soil as well as illegal immigrants who have no business being here.
As for dual nationals who take part in these Islamist movements, they must be stripped of their nationality and expelled from the country for good.
My fellow countrymen and women, we are a brave people.
The country must be united at this terrible time.
Beyond any words, it is strong and relentless action that will protect the French people and keep this unity going.

Long live the Republic!
Long live France!
